title: Claude Lynch
text:
I’m a PhD candidate at the Centre for Advanced Spatial Analysis, UCL.
My priority as an academic is to create and encourage research with application, that allows theory in geography to touch practice, and inform the way institutions, governments and social movements engage with ideas of space and place. Within this, my PhD project aims to understand how simulations from transport models are best applied to regional political contexts. My research interests sit across critical GIS, with a focus on transport justice and regional politics.
  
More about me







 Back to top

title: **CLAUDE LYNCH**
text:
Maybe you’re wondering why this website is called ‘siskiyoucedar’. Long story short, in 2013 I bought a bar of soap with the same name. The syllables stuck with me, and so it goes.

‘A good way to rid one’s self of a sense of discomfort is to do something. That uneasy, dissatisfied feeling is actual force vibrating out of order’ - William Morris

Not to wildly pivot from soap to political praxis, but I think the driving force of academia is to show where meaningful change should be happening and help point society in that direction. For as long as science and politics are intertwined, we have to do our best to tip the scales in favour of those who need our help the most.
